greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=19, a(2)=13, a(3)=37; thereafter a(n) = gpf(a(n-1)+a(n-2)+a(n-3)), where gpf = "greatest prime factor".
comment: This is the periodic part of A177904 - it is periodic with period 212.
A smaller start is a(1)=3, a(2)=13, a(3)=7, but that would not produce the terms in the order of their first appearance in A177904.
There are several open questions concerning this class of sequences - see the Back-Caragiu reference in A177904.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..212
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 18 2010
